events.message: The applicant submitted their car loan application online, providing initial vehicle details and personal information.
The loan application was categorised under Auto Loan based on keywords such as 'car' and 'vehicle' in the applicant’s statement.
A dedicated loan officer was assigned to the application to assist with the process and answer any questions regarding the car purchase financing.
The initial review of the loan application was conducted, verifying basic eligibility criteria and reviewing the proposed vehicle details.
Additional documents were requested from the applicant, including proof of income, vehicle purchase agreement, and identification.
The applicant submitted all requested documentation, including pay stubs, vehicle invoice, and driver’s license images as required.
A credit check was performed on the applicant to assess financial reliability and history relevant to the auto loan application.
The risk assessment report was finalized, analyzing credit score, debt-to-income ratio, and current financial obligations against auto loan policies.
A formal loan offer was presented to the applicant outlining loan amount, interest rate, repayment terms, and other relevant conditions.
The applicant provided feedback requesting clarification on monthly payments and the total loan term duration for the auto loan offer.
Due to the applicant’s questions regarding loan terms, the application was escalated to a senior loan officer for further review.
The auto loan application was approved following additional reviews, confirming the applicant meets all credit and income requirements.
The loan amount was successfully disbursed to the dealership account as per the agreement, enabling the vehicle purchase to proceed.
A follow-up call was conducted with the applicant to ensure loan repayment plan understanding and to offer support if needed.
The auto loan application case was officially closed after confirming all terms were accepted and the vehicle purchase was completed.
